subject: No Foolin'
event:
Another tradition bites the dust.  (In fandom, anything you do twice is a tradition).

I know, I know, it's April 1st.  For the past two years I've made a bogus April Fool's post on this day, but not this year.  The day came rushing up on me too fast, I fear.  I had a vague notion of announcing that HBO had recast the part of Tyrion, replacing Peter Dinklage with Gary Coleman, but somehow I don't think that would have fooled anyone.  Then I thought maybe I could post that William Shatner had been added to the cast as Barristan Selmy... but that would not have flown either.  

So I'll have to take a pass.  Next year, maybe.

comments.upictitle: Soufflé Girl Wannabe: I am Kirok!
comments.article: Of course, this being April Fool's day, this means that these things have actually happened, doesn't it?

Being as it's April Fool's, this can all be part of some elaborate ploy on your part to get us to let our guard down, so that you spring your prank upon us later in the day.  So be warned that if I see any other posts from you today, I shall remain wary. ;)

comments.upictitle: Soufflé Girl Wannabe: Saxon - Made of Win
comments.article: Great Minds thing alike. I do worry about what grrm is going to spring on us later!
Don't feel disappointed! Look at it as an opportunity to spend a whole year planning the best thing ever for next time. :D
i think an excellent april fools would have been if you announced dance with dragons was finished!! but god help you when you admitted it was a joke!! :)

Or better yet: I can imagine George claiming ongoing unhappiness with the direction Dance is taking, and announcing he decided to scrap most of it and start over.

Then again, given how, erm, intense the discussion tends to become whenever the word 'dance' comes up in George's posts already, maybe we're better off with the Gary Coleman idea, right.
oooh then I could have a Tshirt made that said, "Tyrion is what Willis was talking about."

Thank you for the biggest laugh I've had all day.

(can I preemptively order ten?)
Mr. Shatner as Biter!
comments.subject: Oh oh oh...I know I know I know!

comments.article: I think Alan Moore's 1980's League of Extraordinary Gentlemen prank would have one-upped anything you came up with, so no harm, no foul.

Last year I had a great prank that worked well. (Told a bunch of friends I was being transferred to London.) This year, I didn't even think about it. It made me sad! It must be an off year for pranking.
comments.subject: Me too, man.

comments.article:
Speaking of Shatner, have you seen GQ's amazing interview/profile of Shatner?

A true original, and an American national treasure (no, Canada, you cannot have him back), much as the article indicates.

But Bill Shatner would be a much better Ser Jorah Mormont.
I can just... see him... giving his well-meaning advice *and*... somewhat feeble amorous advances *to*... Princess... Daenerys.

Kvothe is currently beating Jaime on Suvudu and I'm still hoping that you'll have a chance to write a story of their cage match. It would certainly make me forget all about the lack of an April Fool's joke. (I admit voting for Kvothe and Jaime primarily in hopes I'd get to read dueling battle accounts)

I also meant to set the clocks back or something but never got around to it.

I've shared A Game of Thrones with my cousin, grandfather, and a few friends. I really love the series and thanks for your work.
comments.subject: Same Here

comments.article:
This year is going by way too fast... I forgot all about April Fools, as a matter of fact I forgot about March itself...
GRRM... I am new to the post. About to finish AFFC and lovin' it.
Patiently awaiting the next, and enjoying your blog!!!!!!
comments.subject: WAY TOO FAST

comments.article:
You can post that Jaime is winning his cage match...

We need more votes!
comments.subject: Here's one

comments.article:
Off Topic I know, but Patrick Rothfuss wrote a story about the fight against Jaime and now it seems that Kvothe is winning.
We cant let that happen. You need to write something for Suvudu George.

Hurry or it will be the end of the Valonquar....
comments.subject: Jaime

comments.article: You gave me a chuckle even without playing a prank.  William Shatner would make a great Selmy!  Hah!  Great image that.  Thanks much!
comments.subject: All is well!

comments.upictitle: Nuchtchas (Nutty, NIMLAS, however you know me): comic me
comments.article: You should have said that the roles of Sansa and Dany were now going to be aged and played by Britney Spears and Mandy Moore helping both musicians grow as actresses and that the role of Arya would be played by Miley Cyris because the pop star/nickid was trying to break her sweet and innocent typecast :)
Whatchu talkin bout, Jaime?!
See, what you need to do is do whatever prank a week early, or more, so people aren't expecting it.
Sometimes, practical jokes take a long time to come to fruition.
Gary Coleman as Tyrion? Too predictable. Gary Coleman as Varys, on the other hand...

Hey George.
Jaime is losing right now, and the vote ends tomorrow. He might benefit from another livejournal link post by you
(http://www.suvudu.com/2010/03/cage-match-2010-round-4-14-kvothe-versus-15-jaime-lannister.html?ref=Widget-Bracket)
comments.subject: Suvudu Cage Match Semifinals

comments.article:
Totally off-topic, as this is no joke: Jaime needs your help! (And someone needs to tell Rothfuss no Westerosi would never bark the expletive, "Good lord!")

http://www.suvudu.com/2010/03/cage-match-2010-round-4-14-kvothe-versus-15-jaime-lannister.html
comments.subject: Help the Kingslayer Slay!

comments.article: I think most of us would have believed Ned Stark had gone to Gilbert Gottfried...
Of course, that would be cool if Shatner took the role.
